hooks.name: component-structure-validator
hooks.description: Validates that React components follow Chakra UI patterns and TypeScript best practices

action.prompt:
A React component file was just written at ${tool.file_path}.

Please validate the component follows these patterns:

1. **Chakra UI Patterns**:
   - Uses Chakra UI components (Box, Flex, Button, etc.)
   - Follows Chakra styling conventions (not inline styles or CSS classes)
   - Uses theme tokens for colors, spacing, typography

2. **TypeScript Best Practices**:
   - Has proper TypeScript interface for props
   - Uses type-safe prop destructuring
   - Exports component and its props interface

3. **Component Structure**:
   - Follows functional component pattern
   - Has clear, descriptive component name
   - Props interface matches component name (e.g., ButtonProps for Button)

Read the file and analyze it. If any issues are found, provide a clear warning to the user with specific recommendations for improvement.

If the component looks good, briefly confirm it follows the patterns.

Do not make changes unless explicitly asked - just validate and report.

hooks.name: accessibility-gate
hooks.description: Checks for proper accessibility attributes in JSX/TSX files

action.prompt: A React component file was just edited at ${tool.file_path}. Please check for accessibility issues: 1. **Images**: - All and tags have alt text - Alt text is descriptive (not just "image") 2. **Interactive Elements**: - Buttons have accessible labels or aria-label - Links have descriptive text or aria-label - Custom interactive elements have proper ARIA roles 3. **Form Elements**: - Inputs have associated labels or aria-label - Form controls have proper aria-describedby for error messages 4. **Semantic HTML**: - Uses semantic elements (nav, main, aside, etc.) - Headings follow proper hierarchy (h1 -> h2 -> h3) 5. **ARIA Attributes**: - aria-hidden used appropriately - aria-live regions for dynamic content - Proper aria-expanded, aria-controls for interactive widgets Read the edited file section and check for these issues. If any accessibility problems are found, provide a WARNING with specific fixes. If the component has good accessibility, briefly confirm it passes the check. Do not make changes unless explicitly asked - just validate and warn.

hooks.name: test-coverage-reminder
hooks.description: Reminds to run/write tests when component files were modified during the session

action.prompt:
The session is ending. Please check if any component files (.tsx, .jsx) were created or modified during this session.

Use git status or search through the conversation history to identify modified files.

If component files were changed:

1. Check if corresponding test files exist (e.g., Button.tsx -> Button.test.tsx or Button.spec.tsx)

2. Remind the user:
   - To run existing tests: `npm test` or `pnpm test`
   - To write tests if missing, covering:
     - Component renders without errors
     - Props are handled correctly
     - User interactions work as expected
     - Accessibility features are present

3. Suggest running test coverage: `npm test -- --coverage`

If no component files were changed, or if tests were already written/run during the session, you can skip this reminder.

Keep the reminder brief and actionable.
